title: Continuous Assessment Test 03 - Everyday Conversations & Cultural Context
description: This CAT evaluates knowledge of Dholuo adjectives, verbs, and tenses in everyday conversational contexts.

questions.question: [Adjectives & Verbs Part 01] Which of the following is the correct comparative form of marach (bad)?
[Adjectives & Verbs Part 01] In the sentence Mae mit kaka macha, what grammatical function does the word kaka serve?
[Adjectives & Verbs Part 01] Which verb form in Dholuo would best express "to study" in the infinitive?
[Adjectives & Verbs Part 01] What prefix is used in Dholuo to conjugate a verb for the subject pronoun Wan (we)?
[Adjectives & Verbs Part 01] What is the meaning of the Dholuo sentence Paul nitie?
[Adjectives & Verbs Part 01] Which of the following correctly expresses "There is no food" in Dholuo?
[Adjectives & Verbs Part 01] What construction would correctly express "The most intelligent" in Dholuo using the standard superlative form?
[Adjectives & Verbs Part 01] What does the phrase rateng' ti mean in Dholuo as used in intensification?
[Adjectives & Verbs Part 01] Which Dholuo construction correctly conveys "I am here" using the verb tie?
[Adjectives & Verbs Part 01] In the morphosyntactic structure of Dholuo adjectives, what is the primary function of the "ma-" prefix?
options: It turns adjectives into nouns to enhance formality
It intensifies the semantic value of the adjective
It acts as a linking particle, converting descriptors into relative clauses
It marks future tense in attributive clauses

questions.question: [Adjectives & Verbs Part 01] Which of the following Dholuo adjectives does not follow the ma- prefix pattern?
[Adjectives & Verbs Part 01] What semantic distinction is drawn between matho and motho in Dholuo adjective clauses?
[Adjectives & Verbs Part 01] Which adjective is irregular in both form and developmental reference, bypassing the standard prefix system?
[Adjectives & Verbs Part 01] Which of the following Dholuo adjective pairs exemplifies pluralization through suffixation?
[Adjectives & Verbs Part 01] Which adjective conveys moral and aesthetic approval in Dholuo and may intensify with ahinya?
[Adjectives & Verbs Part 01] In Dholuo, which adjective denotes sufficiency, and may commonly lose the "ma-" prefix in speech?
[Adjectives & Verbs Part 01] Which of the following color adjectives derives from an environmental referent?
[Adjectives & Verbs Part 01] What is the plural form of the adjective marach ("bad")?
[Adjectives & Verbs Part 01] Which of the following adjectives is classified as invariant, resisting inflection even in plural contexts?
[Verbs Part 02] Which of the following best illustrates the use of an applicative extension in Dholuo?
[Verbs Part 02] In Dholuo, which of the following reflects the correct verb structure for a transitive construction?
options: Subject Prefix + Object Suffix + Verb Root
Subject Prefix + Verb Root + Object Suffix
Object Suffix + Subject Prefix + Verb Root

questions.question: [Verbs Part 02] What enables a verb like "goyo" to function independently in a clause?
options: Morphological fusion of subject and object

questions.question: [Verbs Part 02] Which of the following forms shows reflexive morphology?
[Verbs Part 02] What is the grammatical issue with the phrase "an kod guok" when expressing possession?
[Verbs Part 02] Which example best illustrates antipassive usage in Dholuo?
[Verbs Part 02] Identify the correct Dholuo translation of "They have killed us."
[Verbs Part 02] Which form demonstrates a fully fused verbal clause in Dholuo?
[Verbs Part 02] Which is true about the verb nyuomo in Dholuo?
options: It can be used by any gender
It only applies to legal ceremonies

questions.question: [Verbs Part 02] What grammatical process forms the noun luokruok?
[Verbs Part 02] Why does Gikendore mean "They are married"?
[Tenses] In the construction "Nene osebedo ka koth chue," which grammatical element is primarily responsible for placing the action prior to another past event?
options: The auxiliary "nene" combined with the perfective infix "-se-"

questions.question: [Tenses] Which of the following Dholuo sentences best exemplifies a contracted form of the recent past perfective?
[Tenses] What is the function of the "-ga" suffix in the verb phrase "Nene achiemoga"?
options: To express politeness or deference in past narration
To emphasize completed action in the past
To mark obligation tied to habitual action
To denote a repeated or ongoing past action (past habitual/continuous)

questions.question: [Tenses] In which of the following constructions is the infinitive verb form maintained despite temporal marking?
[Tenses] Which of the following demonstrates incorrect application of the overt subject rule?
[Tenses] Which sentence properly expresses the future continuous tense in Dholuo?
[Tenses] What does the prefix "nyoro-" convey in a sentence like "Nyoro natuo"?
options: Specific reference to an event that occurred yesterday

questions.question: [Tenses] Which structure correctly conveys the modal "should have" in Dholuo?
[Tenses] What is the primary pedagogical challenge in interpreting present continuous actions in Dholuo?
options: The need to memorize subject-object order
The absence of explicit progressive morphology, requiring contextual inference
The lack of plural forms in present verbs

questions.question: [Tenses] Which of the following morphosyntactic combinations indicates "They had been..." in Dholuo past perfect tense?
